comment: Do NOT take this class or this professor at all!!! He gives a solid weeks worth of work every 3 days! And I thought this was a French course but turns out you'll spend most of the time creating YouTube style content in Adobe! Like whattt???!!!!! If I wanted to take a class for that I would. Absolutely insane deadlines and workload are also crazyyy.

One of the worst professors at Kennesaw State University. DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR. The amount of work he gives would have you believe you're planning on becoming a french author. If you need to take this course just wait until there's another available professor. I REPEAT DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Very bad teacher. Wouldn't recommend
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: If you take him be prepared to spend most of your time NOT learning french and instead making pointless webpages and writing long essays about nothing.

I took this course with a lot of knowledge of french since I had taken it all throughout high school. So, I decided to take this course this summer to knock out a gen ed. I made a huge mistake choosing this professor. Now, I'm spending the entire summer doing egregiously long assignments with vague and unclear instructions. He should be fired.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Save yourself. This professor is arrogant, sassy, and disrespectful. He never grades anything. His feedback is either nonexistent or insignificant. The assignments are just busy work over and over. There is a group project at the end of the semester. The movies we watch are weird and boring. I was miserable all semester.
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: WLC 2209 Online. He gives us a weekly checklist: 2 reading reports every week, and a discussion. Then at the end of the semester is a project. The readings are very long the majority of the time, and it will take you a while.  But if you're looking for an easy A, this isn't the online class to take.Currently taking this course right now
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Very engaging and fun lecturer, classes were not boring. Unconventional assignments and grading but practical for learning languages. Online assignments every Friday and homework with online textbook due weekly. Unit tests are part of the online textbook and are fairly easy and open note. Oral speaking with every unit but fairly easy usually.

WLC 2209 Online. He gave us a weekly checklist: 2 reading reports, and a discussion. Then at the end of the semester is a project. The readings are very long the majority of the time, and it will take you a while. You do learn cool stuff about cultures around the world. But if you're looking for an easy A, this isn't the online class to take.
No grades throughout entire semester. Grading rubric is unclear. No feedback on major projects or discussions since there are no grades posted.

Very friendly, gives clear feedback and instructions, really cares about his students, accepting. The group project was a big part of this course, but it was the best I've ever been in and wasn't difficult or stressful. Some of the movies we watched were boring, but the class was fairly fun and engaging. Always willing to talk/answer questions.

Really awesome! Gives very clear instructions and feedback. Accessible for questions in and outside of class. A group project was a big part of this course, but it was the best group project I've ever been in and wasn't difficult or stressful. The movies we watched were kind of boring but the class was pretty fun. Definitely recommend!!!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--So many papers--Online Savvy

comment: Beware if you are a student that prefers feedback and graded assignments in a timely manner.

Take this class IF you are prepared to work EVERY DAY on French. He does assign too much homework, pop quizzes, and busywork. Still, at the end of the semester, he tried to convince me to minor in the language and was very encouraging. My classmates and I agree, he is the sweetest man but a frightening professor.

Not only will you have 2-3 projects to work on during the week, but add a bunch of discussion posts and pointless quizzes. No Tests either in this class. I've spent the majority of the semester on this particular class alone and constant 50s and 65s on multiple projects.

I spent 12 hours a week at a minimum on this class and still missed some assignments, then did poorly on the ones I did do because I didn't include some information that wasn't on the rubric! I've had professors give us less work in a week than he does every 2 days. Doesn't grade based on your French skills. Be ready to stay up till midnight daily.

This professor is very unclear on assignments and will grade you poorly, no matter how hard you work, and will deduct points on factors you were never instructed to include. He expects you to be a mind-reader. Took a lot of trial and error and emailing him to final start getting the grades I deserved. Just avoid if you can- not worth the headache.

This is one of the worst teachers Ive had! I struggle with French and instead of helping he just looks at you like its your fault you arent learning. SO ARROGANT!!! Told me not to use any materials but the one HE WROTE. Terrible teacher, wont help you, ridiculous grader, unclear on assignments. Avoid this teacher!

Couldn't have gotten through this class without the help of my partner. You get to choose your partner for his class and each week you guys have an interview that is due. I became friends with my partner within the second week and my grades started getting better! Heavy workload each week and the prof's instructions aren't clear.
I took 3 years of French in high school, so I have a good familiarity of the language. I get excellent feedback on my assignments, but make no higher than a B. Would not recommend.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: This was supposed to be an online class that takes 2 hours of the day. Not the whole week, which is what he did. There is a lot of busy work on D2L and the French Supersite. He has group projects when the students are all online! Difficult teacher to work with. The busy work on D2L is what may mess you up if you take him.

Professor McLaughlin is the best professor I've ever had at KSU. He's super knowledgeable and passionate about film and will make you look at movies in new ways. Blogging was an interesting way to participate in class, but you'll get the hang of it. He's really understanding as well, just make sure you let him know if you're having difficulty!

Dr. Mclaughlin is AWESOME. I took him for Transnational Film Studies (Film 3200) and had an amazing experience.  He initiates interesting discussions each and every day. The films we watched inlude Avatar, Snowpiercer, and Seven Samurai. He does a great job of engaging us on a personal level and connecting with out generation. HIGHLY recommend.

Not worth your time. Be prepared to be graded harshly. He does not clarify what will be on a test. You are given a huge workload that you will 100% have to teach yourself. Don't try to get ahead of the game because if you try to teach yourself enough phrases to complete his assignments, he will assume you used a translator. Find someone else.
Wouldn't recommend. The tests take two days along with an online paper/presentation. Rude and discouraging. Confusing when he grades on participation. Harsh grader.

He is really knowledgeable in transnational film. There is a strong focus on French culture but he is good at introducing unfamiliar cultures as well. He requires a lot of small writing assignments throughout the semester, 1 large paper towards the end of the course, and 1 group project. He will encourage students to communicate and participate.

FLIPPED CLASSROOM- you are expected to learn things outside of classroom (via online homework) and review in class- not as bad as you think. + His tests are multiple parts. A reading comprehension, conversation and some time of presentation. You can easily rack up points. I wouldn't take any other teacher for French. just DO HW & GO TO CLASS!
good teacher, easy class if you do the homework when its due

Flipped classroom style of teaching is not for everyone, but he does the best rendition of it I've seen. Very clear on... everything. Crystal clear grading criteria, extensive and detailed lectures, confident and knowledgeable. Would and will take for every other class I can. Not an easy professor, but you will leave knowing the language.

Dr. McLaughlin has a flipped classroom (which for those of you who may not know, is when you learn the stuff outside of class online and then just review in class), so if that doesn't work for you, don't take him. He's also not very helpful. I took 4 years of French in high school, and I think already knowing the stuff was the only reason I passed.

Professor McLaughlin is a really chill guy. My only issue with this class is that it is a flipped classroom, meaning you have to teach yourself everything and then come to class with the expectation that you know what you are doing. NOT an easy class. I would prefer a traditional classroom for teaching a LANGUAGE. If he were hands on it would be A+

My issue came in when he did not grade a presentation and it cost me my grade. I'm talking about less than 1.5 points needed. After attempting contact multiple times he did not respond.   Don't expect him to be a teacher you get to know. Just treat it like a business transaction, do your work, get your B+ and don't expect to "wow" him.

He expects a lot from his students but he is also really personable. You have to put effort in if you want a good grade. Participation is 20% of your grade so you must go to class. He does give extra credit points (up to 5 on final grade) but the assignments do require work.

For each exam you have one in-class quiz, one written assignment, and two oral speaking exams. This is for EACH exam and we had 5, including the final. This may be an advantage for some, but for those who don't have a good grasp on the language, please take someone else because you will hate this class. Good luck.

Really funny and energetic professor, obviously loves to teach. Gives very fair and systematic assessments in 3-4 different parts (reading, speaking and writingpresenting) every other week; easy to do well even if you bomb one of the sections. Granted, I'm biased because I'm a French minor and chose to take this 6 hr course to challenge myself.

Interesting guy... he has a tumblr where he basically does caligraphy, and he is "a singersongwriter at heart..." i did listen to his music. He's a funny guy. Good french teacher. 4 tests and 3 one page papers throughout the semester. I got a high B withouth really putting any effort in. Also, do the homework. It's a completion grade. BS it.

The workload for this class is a lot but that's to be expected for for a 6 hr class! It definitely makes you speak more. There are 3 parts to his evaluations,so it all balances out. With that being said, I'd recommend his class. He is a great prof & if you're gonna do the extra credits, do them AHEAD of time.
He was a excellent teacher if you're willing to learn

Greatest professor ever! You can't leave his class saying you did not learn unless you just don't try- to which that's on you. No he wont hand you an A or B but you can earn it if you work hard and are willing to learn French. He's a Super interactive, very kind, passionate guy who loves his students and wants them to do well! Couldnt ask for more!

He was a wonderful teacher. I enjoyed his class. He is full of energy which was awesome and you can tell that he loves the language.half of the test were oral and the other were written so if you suck at oral but good at writing you will be fine. I learned a lot in his class and I highly recommend  him.

He challenges his students and that's great!He will definitely help you improve your French. When he talks about French, you can tell he loves it. His oral exams are a pain, but you just have to practice speaking.Written exams were okay, but can be hard if that's not your strong point. Overall, you gotta earn the A. He truly is a great prof.

Intense! But, if you want to learn intermediate French, this is for you. Be prepared to study and interact with your classmates 4 days per week. Remember this is a 6 credit hour class and it feels like it; not for the faint-hearted.
I think he's great. There is a lot of homework but it doesn't take long. He uses a lot of different teaching methods so it's easy to learn. Not a hard grader. Makes class fun. I recommend him!

VERY difficult class. Don't take it expecting an easy grade; he really expects you to learn French. I really enjoyed the class because I love learning new languages, but it was horrible to many students. LOTS of homework. He is rude to students that don't do work. However, he is willing to answer any questions, and is happy when you take initiative
Nice guy but class was not enjoyable. Very arduous class and lots of homework. Unless French comes some what naturally to you, this class will be tough.

If you are trying to get above a C don't take him. Hard, unclear and explanations do not help. He is a nice guy but being nice does not make a grade. Take someone else as his class does not help. His class has more homework than some Sr. classes. His class makes it difficult to really understand French. The tutors aren't helpful either.

Unless French is your MAJOR do not take Him. Not very clear on what he wants to be done. Grades TOO HARD for it to be an entry level course. Other students made this class worth attending.Not very clear on what he is grading on. Im still taking French because I have(& interested)to but just not with him.

Expects you to "really learn language," so no easy grades. Get as many points from attendance & hw as possible. Form a study group to practice for oral exams & use tutors in library for written stuff. Prof is rude but is "like that to everyone" so don't take it personally. Redaction directions are overly complicated & expectations are unclear.

I didn't like this professor. I have taken several French classes in high school and it's shocking that my college French class turned out to be useless. You dont learn e language you learn the culture. McLaughlin is a jerk and treats this class like it's your only one. He's useless as well as the textbook.

Excellent professor. Very personable and interested giving students a great foundation of Francophone culture and language. He does not expect fluency after this first class, but he does expect participation and preparation. Have fun! It's a new language and very exciting to learn!

Difficult class but incredibly rewarding. I learned more in his class than I did in 1001, and he reignited my love of the French language. Highly recommen his class to anyone serious about learning a language!
Exceptionally hard. Very inflexible. Good class materials.

Looooved this class. He's funny, charming, and incredibly intelligent and passionate. There's a lot of online homework and a lot of little group work exercises in class. I learned so much, and highly recommend this class.

Professor McLaughlin is a great professor! He's always willing to meet with students if they are having trouble and he genuinely wants to see all of his students succeed. He does assign a lot of homework and he does speak French A LOT, but he will slow down and go over things again and again if you need him to. Highly Recommended!

Professor McLaughlin is great. I took four years of French in high school and I've learned more with Professor McLaughlin in one semester than I did in those four years. He's funny, engaging, and pretty relaxed. I just wish I could take a class with him next semester too!

Not an easy class, but he is the best French professor I've had yet! He is upbeat and incredibly patient and helpful! He will take the time to explain anything you ask or have difficulty with. I recommend him!!!

This teacher expects you to come to class and expects you to do your homework before class (online).  He is very difficult but hey, guess what? Book is a must- no getting around it. Lot of group work. Mandatory attendance. Prof. has a bad habit of failing to remember you have other classes.

Prof. McLaughlin uses the book plus an online homework program that you have to keep up with.  Not an easy class, but if you're as passionate about French as he is, you'll do fine.  Class participation counts and you have to speak in class a lot, especially in groups.  Not a slack class.

This guy acts like everyone needs to pick up French as fast as he does. He only speaks for the most part in French.  He'll say ask if you understand and if you don't he'll just proceed without explaining it!  I would highly disrecommend this Prof! He has a "I was in France attitude so I am better than you" and mentality! Run as far as you can!!!!!!

Great professor. He is very passionate about what he teaches and doesn't put up with laziness. Be sure to come prepared for class because he will call on you to answer questions. And definitely buy the book for this class!

I've taken him for both 1001 and 1002. Yes, there is a LOT of work, but come on guys, he's trying to teach you a new language. How are you supposed to learn it without a lot of work and practice? Overall, a reasonably easy class, very helpful teacher, but yes, heavy workload.

He is really passionate about the course so you need to be. Requires lots of studying and LOTS of homework. If you don't have the time to go to the conversation table with the french club or go to the language lab often then I would say don't take him. You need to have lots of time to focus on this class if you want to pass. But he is a great prof.

Professor Mclaughlin is a passionate teacher, however he speaks French most the class time and never quite explains anything in English.You will leave class asking what you just spent the last hour listening to. TOns of homework, not a slack class, do not take as a cushion class, very nice person, but maybe takes 1001 to serious and hardcore.
Great teacher- recommend.

He is an average professor.  Test aren't that hard.  Notes are easy to keep up with and organized.  Lots of textbook use and partner activities.  He tries to make it slightly exciting.  If you're new to french I suggest you take him- he can be very helpful.

Extreme workload for a foreign language class.  He is a fun teacher and if you can make jokes with him class goes by much better.  Homework is online, and their is PLENTY of it.  He focuses more on being able to speak the language than the written aspect.  Lenient on his grading.  He made foreign language interesting.

I did not like taking this professor. He is a very nice person, but he hardly taught us anything. I left class with very little knowledge in grammar, and it has affected my performance in 2001. If you really want to learn the language and grammar, don't take him.

Quite a heavy workload for this class with Dr. McLaughlin but it will pay off in the end.  He is extremely organized (which some of us need), maybe even a little too much so.  End of the day, I can not complain too much about him as I am learning much!

I absolutely adored Mclaughlin for French. He was and still is extremely helpful and easy to talk to. He knows his French very well (lived in Lyon, did his discertation on French war films). He's very funny, teachs you curse words, and keeps you engaged while he teaches you the language. Best class. Really hard to top it.

Fun professor, and yeah the assignments can be a bit high-schooly, but one can hardly expect to be able to write serious papers in a language one does not know fully. Be attentive, do the homework, participate a little, study a little, and you'll be golden. It's a good class, and he will challenge you.
He's nice, and he loves to speak French, but you will be doing most of the work on your own. Be perpared to work like crazy. He is a lenient grader though.
This teacher was awesome.  Easy to understad, willing to explain, never heard a word about the human condition.

He's a great professor; very helpful and passionate about the language. You do have to work for your grade, though, and it's not always easy. But he makes it interesting; class was always a pleasure. I would recommend him to any serious French student.
I really liked this professor. The class wasn't easy, but he was willing to help and wanted his students to do well.
No Comments
